meanings.definition: A surface of which one end or side is at a higher level than another; a rising or falling surface.
meanings.sent1: The slope of the hill made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent2: The skier glided down the slope effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The slope of the driveway caused the car to roll back.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a gentle slope, like a hill in spring.
meanings.sent5: The slope of the roof was so steep, it looked like a slide.

meanings.definition: To lean or incline in a particular direction; to slant.
meanings.sent1: She had to slope her head to see around the corner.
meanings.sent2: The road began to slope downwards as they descended.
meanings.sent3: The tower seemed to slope to one side, as if tired.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting started to slope upwards with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The tree seemed to slope towards the sunlight, reaching for warmth.

meanings.definition: To move or go in a particular direction with a continuous motion.
meanings.sent1: The river slope gently towards the sea.
meanings.sent2: The car started to slope downwards on the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The ball seemed to slope towards the goal on its own.
meanings.sent4: Her voice seemed to slope upwards in excitement.
meanings.sent5: The path seemed to slope downwards into the dark forest.
